story:
Once upon a time, in the heart of Azerbaijan, there lived a kind and loving mother named Leyla and her little daughter Aysel. Aysel was a curious and adventurous child who loved exploring the beautiful landscapes of their homeland.

Every night before bedtime, Leyla would tuck Aysel into bed and tell her magical stories of the land of fire. She would recount tales of ancient dragons, noble knights, and enchanted forests that stretched as far as the eye could see.

One night, as the moon shone brightly in the sky, Leyla whispered to Aysel about the legendary firebird that soared high above the mountains, its feathers glowing with the colors of the setting sun. The firebird was said to bring good luck and happiness to all those who gazed upon its magnificent beauty.

Aysel's eyes sparkled with wonder as she listened to her mother's words, dreaming of the day she would catch a glimpse of the magical creature herself. Leyla smiled and kissed her daughter goodnight, knowing that in Aysel's dreams, the firebird would always watch over her and protect her from harm.

And so, under the watchful eye of the firebird, Aysel drifted off to sleep, her heart full of warmth and love. As she slumbered peacefully, the land of fire whispered gentle lullabies, casting a magical spell over mother and daughter, binding them together in an unbreakable bond of love and dreams.

And in the morning light, as the sun rose over the mountains, Leyla and Aysel awoke to a new day filled with endless possibilities and the promise of more adventures to come in the land of fire.

Goodnight, my dear child, sleep tight, and may the firebird's light guide you through the night. Sweet dreams, little one.
